COURSES.name: Engineering Directed Independent Research
COURSES.description: Provides firsthand, supervised research with a faculty advisor or postdoctoral or graduate student mentor. Projects may involve inquiry, design, investigation, scholarship, discovery or application. (S-U)

COURSES.name: Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
COURSES.description: Introduction to the nuclear engineering field and careers in the nuclear industry. Topics include engineering ethics, nuclear history, elementary nuclear and reactor physics, reactor types, nuclear safety, nuclear fuel cycle and radiation protection.

COURSES.name: Nuclear Engineering Analysis 1
COURSES.description: Four one-hour lectures discussing continuous and discrete variable solution methods for the statistical, algebraic, differential and integral equations important in nuclear engineering. Problems involving neutron, photon, fluid and temperature distributions in configuration, time and velocity are mathematically modeled, solved and interpreted.

COURSES.name: Reactor Thermal Hydraulics
COURSES.description: Nuclear applications of fluid mechanics, heat transfer and thermodynamics. Two-phase flow and boiling heat transfer. Heat transfer mechanisms in reactor core and sub-channel thermal hydraulics. Steam generator, power cycles, and balance of plant. Introduction to thermal design for reactors.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 4; Prereq: EML 4140, and ENU 4133 or EGN 3353C.

COURSES.name: Elements of Nuclear and Radiological Engineering Design
COURSES.description: The first of a two-course capstone design sequence. A one-hour lecture that provides preparatory work for ENU 4192. Identification of initial design project(s) and areas of work, selection/assignment of groups to areas of work/tasks, accumulation of reference materials and computer codes and development of initial timelines/milestones.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1; Prereq: ENU 4144; Coreq: ENU 4134, ENU 4612 and ENU 4630.

COURSES.name: Radiation Interactions and Sources 1
COURSES.description: Three one-hour lectures discussing interaction of ionizing radiation with matter; cross sections and radiation fields with emphasis on photons, heavy charged particles and electrons.

COURSES.name: Nuclear Radiation Detection and Instrumentation
COURSES.description: Three one-hour lectures discussing the physics and electronics of radiation detection and instrumentation systems for application to nuclear energy, radiological sciences, radiation protection, medical physics and imaging, and industrial safety and control systems.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: ENU 4605 with a minimum grade of C and EEL 3003.
